ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Auto Stopping Problem
ygData.msgSnippet: Heritrix does not use wget. You might be able to fix wget to use the same proxy as your graphical brwoser, but as I mentioned, Heritrix expects to be able to

From: Gordon Mohr <gojomo@...>
Subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Auto Stopping Problem
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=137285340; y=eHkT0xruVm8h7KYURAEsFYEZL-V1lMDgtR6bOTa9CzvS
X-Yahoo-Profile: gojomo

Heritrix does not use wget.

You might be able to fix wget to use the same proxy as your graphical 
brwoser, but as I mentioned, Heritrix expects to be able to do DNS 
lookups itself. The machine's ability to do DNS lookups will need to be 
remedied in order for Heritrix to work there.

- Gordon @ IA

On 11/24/10 1:30 AM, Allen Sim wrote:
> Hi Gordon,
> Glad to hear from you once again!
> I got few queries here:
> 1. Is Heritrix and WCT using the wget?
> 2. Can I define my proxy server at /etc/wgetrc?
> Please advice and looking forward to hear from you once again.
> Thanks for you guidance and help. Really appreciate it!.
> Regards,
> Allen Wilson
> On Wed, Nov 24, 2010 at 9:10 AM, Gordon Mohr <gojomo@...
> <mailto:gojomo@...>> wrote:
>
>     My guess is that your browser is set up to use an HTTP proxy, and
>     that proxy is doing everything (including name lookups) for the browser.
>
>     But, the machine itself can't do domain lookups. (Or perhaps: can
>     only do a small number of internal/approved domain lookups.) This
>     will need to be resolved in the machine's configuration for Heritrix
>     to work.
>
>     Heritrix can direct HTTP requests through a configured proxy -- but
>     expects to be able to do DNS lookups itself. It would take a code
>     change to enable skipping DNS lookups when an HTTP proxy is to be
>     used, and it would mean there would be no record of the actual IP
>     address contacted (which would be a problem for our usual
>     archival-record use, though would make sense in other applications).
>
>     - Gordon @ IA
>
>
>     On 11/23/10 1:08 AM, Allen Sim wrote:
>
>
>
>         Dear Gordon,
>         I am so glad to hear from you!
>         Wow, Indeed you are very Sharp and you understood my problem!
>         I tried to type the following in my terminal and i got the
>         following:
>         [root@localhost ~]# wget http://www.swinburne.edu.my
>         <http://www.swinburne.edu.my/>
>         --2010-11-23 17:04:43-- http://www.swinburne.edu.my/
>         Resolving www.swinburne.edu.my... failed: Temporary failure in name
>         resolution.
>         wget: unable to resolve host address `www.swinburne.edu.my
>         <http://www.swinburne.edu.my/>
>         <http://www.swinburne.edu.my <http://www.swinburne.edu.my/>>'
>
>         But the strange thing is that i can browse successfully
>         www.swinburne.edu.my <http://www.swinburne.edu.my/>
>         <http://www.swinburne.edu.my <http://www.swinburne.edu.my/>> at
>         the machine's
>
>         graphical browser.
>         What's wrong with it? Is it because of my proxy setting or my
>         DNS setting.
>         Please advice and looking forward to hear from you.
>         Thanks for your guidance and advice,
>         Allen WIlson
>
>         On Tue, Nov 23, 2010 at 3:06 AM, Gordon Mohr <gojomo@...
>         <mailto:gojomo@...>
>         <mailto:gojomo@... <mailto:gojomo@...>>> wrote:
>
>             The fact that the first error is a DNS failure, and that
>         prevents
>             further progress, suggests that the ability of the crawler
>         machine
>             to do DNS lookups -- both from a command-line, and from Java
>         -- is
>             the first thing to look at.
>
>             On the crawling machine itself, can you visit
>         <http://www.swinburne.edu.my/> (from a command-line browser or tool
>             like 'wget'/'curl' if the machine doesn't have a graphical
>         browser)?
>
>             There *might* be a little more detail on the DNS error in the
>         'local-errors.log' in the crawl's logs directory as well.
>
>             - Gordon @ IA
>
>
>             On 11/18/10 10:09 PM, ssgtitanic wrote:
>
>                 Hi,
>                 Hi,
>                 I successfully downloaded and deployed WCT 1.5 and
>         indeed it's a
>                 wonderful tool for harvesting!
>                 This morning I tried to harvest few websites. The first two
>                 websites that I harvested were okay. As I proceed to my
>         third
>                 website, The Target Instances itself only run for few
>         seconds
>                 (00:00:18) then it automatically 'Stopping' then after few
>                 seconds it turned to 'harvested' with 0 bytes data
>         downloaded.I
>                 restart my server and Apache-tomcat, the problem still
>         persist.
>
>                   Following is the crwal.log logfile:
>                 2010-11-18T04:14:11.482Z    -1          -
>                 dns:www.swinburne.edu.my <http://www.swinburne.edu.my/>
>         <http://www.swinburne.edu.my <http://www.swinburne.edu.my/>> P
>
>         http://www.swinburne.edu.my/ text/dns #001
>                 20101118041409425+2055 - - 3t
>                 2010-11-18T04:14:11.786Z    -6          -
>         http://www.swinburne.edu.my/ - - no-type #002 - - - 2t
>                 Displaying: 100% of 239 B
>                 crawl report.txt:
>                 Crawl Name:
>                 Crawl Status: Finished
>                 Duration Time: 20s617ms
>                 Total Seeds Crawled: 0
>                 Total Seeds not Crawled: 1
>                 Total Hosts Crawled: -1
>                 Total Documents Crawled: 2
>                 Processed docs/sec: 0
>                 Bandwidth in Kbytes/sec: 0
>                 Total Raw Data Size in Bytes: 0 (0 B)
>                 Novel Bytes: 0 (0 B)
>                 Displaying: 100% of 271 B
>                 Frontier report.txt
>                 frontier empty
>                 Displaying: 100% of 15 B
>
>                 Can you please guide me. what's wrong with it? Is it my
>         setting?
>                 As I am refeering to Heritrix status code, I found the
>         following:
>                   -1 DNS lookup failed
>                   -6 Prerequisite domain-lookup failed, precluding fetch
>         attempt
>
>                 How am I going to fix it? Please help and advice.
>
>                 Looking forward to hear from you.
>
>                 Thanks in advance,
>                 Allen Wilson
